metadata.title: CVE-2024-42261 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/v3d: Validate passed in drm syncobj handles in the timestamp extensionIf userspace provides an unknown or invalid handle anywhere in the handlearray the rest of the driver will not handle that well.Fix it by checking handle was looked up successfully or otherwise fail theextension by jumping into the existing unwind.(cherry picked from commit 8d1276d1b8f738c3afe1457d4dff5cc66fc848a3)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42261` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
